title: Multiple and Complex Questions
goal: Practice using multiple question words in complex queries.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Question word review:

xu → ?
ma → ?
mo → ?
xo → ?

(Answers: yes/no, who/what (sumti), what is/does (selbri), how many)

New Material (5-7 min)

Multiple ma in One Bridi

You can use multiple ma to ask about several things:

ma dunda ma mi

Who gives what to me?

ma klama ma

Who goes where?

Answering Multiple Questions

Fill in each ma with the answer:

Q: ma dunda ma mi A: la .bob. cu dunda lo plise mi (Bob gives apples to me.)

Combining Question Types

xo prenu cu klama ma

How many people go where?

ma zukte ma mu'i ma

Who does what motivated by what?

Using Cause/Effect Words

ma rinka lo nu do gleki

What causes you to be happy?

do snada mu'i ma

You succeed motivated by what?

Key Point

Complex questions combine question words or ask about cause/effect relationships.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Multiple ma

Create questions:

  1. Who gives what to whom? → ?
  2. Who talks to whom? → ?
  3. Who goes where? → ?
Answers
  1. ma dunda ma ma
  2. ma tavla ma
  3. ma klama ma

Exercise 2: Combined Questions

Translate:

  1. How many people go to Paris? → ?
  2. What causes what? → ?
  3. Who does what? → ?
Answers
  1. xo prenu cu klama la .paris.
  2. ma rinka ma
  3. ma zukte ma

Exercise 3: Cause Questions

Translate:

  1. What causes you to be happy?
  2. What is your motive for going?
  3. What is the result of working?
Answers
  1. ma rinka lo nu do gleki
  2. ma mukti lo nu do klama
  3. ma jalge lo nu gunka

items.text: How many people go to Paris? → ?
What causes you to be happy?
What is your motive for going?
What is the result of working?

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "Who goes where?" → ma klama ma
  2. "What causes this?" → ma rinka ti
  3. "What do you do?" → do zukte ma

Today's Review

Complex question patterns:

Pattern Meaning
ma verb ma Who does-to-whom?
xo X verb ma How many X do what?
ma rinka ma What causes what?

Summary

You practiced complex questions with multiple ma and combined question words. These allow sophisticated queries about actions and causes.
